pullRequest.title: Enable testJITServer tests for Power
pullRequest.bodyText:
This commit enables testJITServer_0(1) tests for
ppc64le and ppc64le_jit. This means that test behavior
is the same between x86 and Power. On the *_jit platforms,
all tests are run with JITServer, while on regular platforms,
only testJITServer tests use it.

nodes.bodyText: I am guessing that ^arch.arm means NOT arm. Is there a a way to include platforms rather than excluding? I would prefer that because if in the future a new platform comes along, it will be automatically included.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -598,7 +598,7 @@
 		echo $(Q)$(TEST_JDK_BIN)$(D)jitserver doesn't exist; assuming this JDK does not support JITServer and trivially passing the test.$(Q); \
 	fi; \
 	$(TEST_STATUS)</command>
-		<platformRequirements>os.linux,arch.x86,bits.64,vm.cmprssptrs</platformRequirements>
+		<platformRequirements>os.linux,^arch.arm,^arch.aarch64,^arch.s390x,bits.64,vm.cmprssptrs</platformRequirements>

beforeCommit.message:
Enable testJITServer tests for Power

This commit enables `testJITServer_0(1)` tests for
`ppc64le` and `ppc64le_jit`. This means that test behavior
is the same between x86 and Power. On the `*_jit` platforms,
all tests are run with JITServer, while on regular platforms,
only `testJITServer` tests use it.

Signed-off-by: Dmitry Ten <Dmitry.Ten@ibm.com>
